chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kesean Deleon McCullum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kesean Deleon McCullum.  Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date as well as defendants other pending matter before this court, 21CF4262. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for bail hearing, however defense requests more time and will file additional bail request. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for bail/bond hearing, however defense counsel requests the matter be set over with plea in case 21CF4262. Court GRANTS the adjournment. Case remains calendared in Branch 4 for bail hearing on 7/25/22 at 9:30 am.

Defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M.Davis.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION. 
Court ordered Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Co-Defendants (Kewone Brooks and Kesean Pierce), Christian F., and Joseph K. 

NO CONTACT / NO FIREARMS ORDER; signed and filed.

Defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum in Court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Kesean Deleon McCullum in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint, and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Case is adjourned for Preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
